brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this prospective non-randomized study was to assess the efficacy and safety of
      endomyocardial botulinum toxin injection in left ventricle for preventing episodes of VT
      Storm.

clinical_study.brief_title: Botulinum Toxin Injection to Prevent VT Storm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  3 or more episodes of ventricular tachycardia within 24 hours

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Failure to provide informed consent.

          -  Non-cardiac illness with a life expectancy of less than 3 year

          -  Non-cardiac illness imposing substantial operative mortality

          -  Current participation in another clinical trial in which a patient is taking an
             investigational drug or receiving an investigational medical device

link.description: State Research Institute of Circulation Pathology Official Site

facility.name: State Research Institute of Circulation Pathology

clinical_study.official_title: Endomyocardial Botulinum Toxin Injection Can Decrease the Number of Episodes of VT Storm: Pilot Study

primary_outcome.measure: number of episodes of VT Storm

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
